title: 10: Hygiene in the shed? Let the cows tell you! Scoring system

tasks.task: Hygiene scoring of dairy cows in the shed.
subtasks: Assess the flank and tail area, assigning a score (0, 1, or 2) based on dirtiness.
Assess the lower hind leg area, assigning a score (0, 1, or 2) based on dirtiness.
Assess the udder area, assigning a score (0, 1, or 2) based on dirtiness.
Interpret scores indicating potential hygiene issues (e.g., passageway cleaning, lying area, manure removal).
Consider issues like passageway cleanliness if lower hind legs are dirty.
Investigate lying area hygiene if udder and lower parts are dirty.
Evaluate tail and flank dirtiness for possible diarrhea or diet-related issues.
Assess overall dirtiness for potential overcrowding or manure acceleration problems.
